A train, an hour after starting, meets with an accident which detains it a half hour, after which it proceeds at $ \frac{3}{4}$ of its former rate and arrives $ 3 \frac{1}{2}$ hours late.  Had the accident happened $ 90$ miles farther along the line, it would have arrived only $ 3$ hours late.  The length of the trip in miles was:\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 400 \qquad
\textbf{(B)}\ 465 \qquad
\textbf{(C)}\ 600 \qquad
\textbf{(D)}\ 640 \qquad
\textbf{(E)}\ 550$
